titleStmt.title: To the Right Worshipful the master, wardens, and assistants of the Company of Grocers The humble petition of Major Salloway.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A94687 of text R211512 in the English Short Title Catalog (Thomason 669.f.23[16]). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

titleStmt.title: To the Right Worshipful the master, wardens, and assistants of the Company of Grocers The humble petition of Major Salloway.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication from Wing.
A satire on Richard Salwey's imprisonment in the Tower and subsequent release.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

keywords.term: Salwey, Richard, 1615-1685 -- Humor -- Early works to 1800.
